SMW Subobject for (1)High Alchemy value: 54Buy limit: 2000Examine: 1 dose of battlemage potion.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Battlemage potionImage: File:Battlemage potion(1).pngUses infobox: ItemWeight: 0.030Value: 90Version anchor: 1 doseRelease date: 7 June 2018Item ID: 22458

A battlemage potion is a potion that combines the properties of a magic and super defence potion:

  • Magic will be boosted by 4
  • Defence will be boosted by 5 + 15% of the player's level (rounded down)

It can be made by a player with 80 Herblore by using a cadantine on a vial of blood, then adding a potato cactus to the unfinished cadantine blood potion. This grants 155 Herblore experience.

Contents

  • 1 Defence boost by level
  • 2 Creation
  • 3 Products
  • 4 Price per dose
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 Trivia

Defence boost by level[edit | edit source]

Defence boost is calculated with: ⌊ Defence Level × 15 100 ⌋ + 5 {\displaystyle \lfloor {\text{Defence Level}}\times {\frac {15}{100}}\rfloor +5}

Level Boost Level Boost Level Boost
1-6 +5 34-39 +10 67-73 +15
7-13 +6 40-46 +11 74-79 +16
14-19 +7 47-53 +12 80-86 +17
20-26 +8 54-59 +13 87-93 +18
27-33 +9 60-66 +14 94-99 +19

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
1 August 2019
(update)

The battlemage potion's position in the inventory has been made consistent with other potions.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When a player drinks the battlemage potion, the chatbox will state "You drink some of your battlemage potion. It's a little tangy." The bastion potion will also add this.

A '''battlemage potion''' is a potion that combines the properties of a [[magic potion|magic]] and [[super defence potion]]:
*[[Magic]] will be boosted by 4
*[[Defence]] will be boosted by 5 + 15% of the player's level (rounded down)

It can be made by a player with 80 [[Herblore]] by using a [[cadantine]] on a [[vial of blood]], then adding a [[potato cactus]] to the [[Cadantine blood potion (unf)|unfinished cadantine blood potion]]. This grants 155 Herblore experience.
==Defence boost by level==
Defence boost is calculated with: <math>\lfloor \text{Defence Level} \times \frac{15}{100} \rfloor + 5</math>
